content.description: Left corner of the downhill face of easter island boulder.  Sit start with two hands on the good diagonal hold.  Climb up to a diagonal crack, follow that crack up and right then top out.
content.location: Left corner of the downhill side of Easter island boulder.

content.description: 2 hand start in large obvious hold to the right of the crack that runs entire height of boulder.  Climb straight up between 2 vertical cracks.
content.location: On the downhill side of the boulder.  Look for the crack that runs the entire height of the boulder, and climb straight up between the 2 vertical cracks.

content.description: Traverse two parallel cracks across the side of a boulder until you reach the flake, then climb straight up using the flake.
content.location: Look for two parallel diagonal cracks on the side of the Easter Island boulder that is farthest from your car.

content.description: Start with two hands in the downwardly diagonal crack on the left side.  Climb right and up.  Rock sharp.
content.location: Uphill and to the left (west) of surfers boulder, but to the right of the string of faces that are visible from the road.  This climb is on the east side of the rock.

content.description: Start with same two underclings as Backside.  Go up and left using side pulls and then good holds.  Arete off.
content.location: uphill side of Easter Island boulder.

content.description: Start is two underclings. Go right, climb up and around mini-roof and then top out.  Short and sweet.
content.location: Back (uphill) side of Easter island boulder.

content.description: From the east side, the boulder looks like an Easter Island statue.  To come down, use the fallen tree that lays across this boulder and one behind it.  Hang from the tree then drop.
